Models evaluation package¶

cb_predict_models script¶

Functions used for predicting similar books using content based recommendation models.

booksuggest.evaluation.cb_predict_models.main(model_filepath, test_cases_filepath, output_filepath)¶

Script for calculating similar books recommendations of a given model.

Parameters:
  • model_filepath (str) – filepath to the model used for recommendations.
  • test_cases_filepath (str) – filepath containing book ids for which similar are calculated.
  • output_filepath (str) – File where the data frame should be saved.
booksuggest.evaluation.cb_predict_models.predict_model(model, test_cases, rec_count)[source]¶

Uses the given model to calculate similar books.

Each test case is a book id for which similar books are calculated using the given model.

Parameters:
  • model (ICbRecommendationModel) – Model used for recommending similar books.
  • test_cases (List[int]) – List of book ids for which similar books are calculated.
Returns:

Data frame containing the book_id and the similar_book_id columns; grouping is needed in order to retrieve all similar books of a specific book.
Return type:

pd.DataFrame

cb_evaluation script¶

Functions used for calculating recommendation models scores. Main script is responsible for summarizing all created models.

booksuggest.evaluation.cb_evaluation.main(input_directory, similar_books_input, output_filepath)¶

Main function used for summarizing prediction scores.

Parameters:
  • input_directory – Path to the directory containing similar books predictions.
  • similar_books_input – Path to file containing similar books ground truth.
  • rec_count – Top k recommendations to consider.
  • output_filepath – Path to file in which results should be stored.
booksuggest.evaluation.cb_evaluation.calculate_scores(dir_path, test_cases, rec_count)[source]¶

Evaluates the precision and accuracy_score for all models present in the input directory.

Parameters:
  • dir_path (str) – Directory in which calculated similar books predictions
  • saved for each model. (are) –
  • test_cases (Dict[int, List[int]]) – Similar books ground truth.
Return type:

DataFrame
Returns:

Data frame containing presicion and recall scores for all models.
booksuggest.evaluation.cb_evaluation.calculate_single_score(prediction_file, test_cases, rec_count)[source]¶

Calculates precision, accuracy scores and the amount of correct hits for a single prediction file.

Parameters:
  • prediction_file (str) – Path to a file containing similar books predictions.
  • test_cases (Dict[int, List[int]]) – Similar books ground truth.
Return type:

Dict[str, Union[str, float, int]]
booksuggest.evaluation.cb_evaluation.read_similar_books(similar_books_filepath)[source]¶

Converts similar books data from data frame form to dictionary form.

Example

If books 2, 3 are similar to 1 then the result dictionary will have a record in the following form: 1: [2, 3].

Parameters:similar_books_filepath (str) – Path to the file containing similar books data.
Return type:Dict[int, List[int]]
Returns:Dictionary in which keys are book_ids and values are lists of books that are similar to the book_id key.

cf_predict_models script¶

booksuggest.evaluation.cf_predict_models.main(model_filepath, output_filepath, n, chunks_count)¶

Calculates and saves predictions for the given model.

Parameters:
  • model_filepath (str) – Path to a file containg model.
  • output_filepath (str) – Output filepath.
  • n (int) – Number of recommendations to return.
  • chunks_count (int) – In how many chunks split the users set during parallel processing.
booksuggest.evaluation.cf_predict_models.predict_model(model, recommendation_count, chunks_count, batch_size=100000)[source]¶

Calculates top recommendations for every user in the trainset.

Calculations are done in batches to avoid huge memory consumption.

Parameters:
  • model (ICfRecommendationModel) – Already trained model.
  • recommendation_count (int) – Specifies how many recommendations to save.
  • chunks_count (int) – Number of chunks.
  • batch_size (int, optional) – Defaults to 100000. Size of single batch.
Returns:

Data frame with predictions.
Return type:

pd.DataFrame

cf_accuracy_evaluation script¶

cf_effectiveness_evaluation script¶

booksuggest.evaluation.cf_effectiveness_evaluation.main(predictions_dir, to_read_filepath, testset_filepath, threshold, output_filepath)¶

Evaluates precision and recall metrics of predictions on given testsets.

Parameters:
  • predictions_dir (str) – Directory with predictions files.
  • to_read_filepath (str) – Path to a file with to_read data.
  • testset_filepath (str) – Path to a file with testset data.
  • threshold (float) – Threshold for considering specific recommendation a good one.
  • n_min (int) – Lower bound of predictions number generated loop.
  • n_max (int) – Upper bound of predictions number generated loop.
  • output_filepath (str) – Output filepath.
booksuggest.evaluation.cf_effectiveness_evaluation.evaluate_on_predictions(predictions_df, test_df, threshold, n)[source]¶

Calculates the precision and recall of predictions using to_read data.

Parameters:
  • predictions_df (pd.DataFrame) – Data frame with predictions.
  • test_df (pd.DataFrame) – Data frame containg testing data. Should contain [‘user_id’, ‘book_id’] columns.
  • threshold (float) – Treshold for rating to be valid recommendation.
Returns:

Average (precision, recall) for all users.
Return type:

Tuple[float, float]
